title: Tottenham vs Red Star LIVE: Stream, score and team news for Uefa Youth League fixture
text:
Tottenham Hotspur take on Red Star Belgrade in north London this evening, with Mauricio Pochettino’s side in desperate need of a victory to maintain their hopes of qualifying for the Champions League knockout stage.

Spurs drew against Olympiacos in their opening match of the campaign, before being thrashed by Bayern Munich in their own backyard. Should they lose to Red Star at home tonight, their Champions League hopes will likely be over.

Before the two sides meet, their Under-19 teams will go head-to-head in a Uefa Youth League clash. We will bring you live coverage of that match, before focusing our attention on the Champions League. Follow all of the latest updates below:

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.

Spurs vs Red Star Uefa Youth League fixture kicks-off at 3pm

Uefa Champions League fixture kicks-off at 8pm

Follow live coverage of both matches with The Independent

Tottenham u19 vs Red Star Belgrade u19 - Team news Tottenham De Bie, Eyoma, Fagan-Walcott, Binks, Cirkin, Lloyd-Bennett, Bowden, White, Markanday, Robson, Parrott Red Star Katic, Mitrovic, Milikic, Lukic, Blagojevic, Pantovic, Matic, Novakovic, Radulovic, Babic, Burmaz The u19s haven't won a UEFA League game since February. In that match they travelled to PAOK Thessaloniki FC and came away with a 1-0 win. Since then they've played three matches, against Porto, Olympiacos and Bayern Munich and have lost two with one draw. They'll be hoping for a change in fortunes today. Quite strangely the Tottenham Hotspur under 19s have started their UEFA Youth League campaign in the same fashion as the first team. A 1-1 draw away at Olympiacos in September was followed by a 4-1 defeat at home to Bayern Munich. That leaves the youth side in fourth position with a win much needed. Could the youth team's result this afternoon reflect the first team's this evening? Spurs haven't had the greatest start to their Champions League campaign this season. An opening fixture draw with Olympiacos was followed by a demolishing defeat at home to Bayern Munich. They look to make things right tonight against Red Star who sit second in Group B, but first up the youth teams go head-to-head Advertisement Good afternoon and welcome to our live coverage of Tottenham Hotspur vs Red Star Belgrade. We will bring you live coverage of the Uefa Youth League meeting between the two sides, before the big one: the Champions League clash kicking-off at 8pm.

Match preview:

How can I watch the match?

The match will be televised live on BT Sport 3 and BT Sport Ultimate.

Can I stream the match online?

Yes. The match can be streamed live online via the BT app and website.

When is the match?

The match is today, Tuesday 22 October 2019.

What time is it?

The match gets underway at 8pm BST.

What is the team news?

Lo Celso is back in contention after a hip injury and could feature. Eriksen has meanwhile returned to full training after suffering an injury during the international break.

Ryan Sessegnon has also returned to full training although is believed to be some way off his debut.
description: Tottenham Hotspur take on Red Star Belgrade in north London this evening, with Mauricio Pochettino’s side in desperate need of a victory to maintain their hopes of qualifying for the Champions League knockout stage.
